<a href="https://magicspoon.com/products/variety-pack-cereal-case/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsorship&utm_campaign=20200523" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Magic Spoon" style="width:100%;max-width: 76px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="76" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8yMzUvMTU4Nzc0MDg1OC1Mb2dvX3B1cnBsZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Saturday morning. </strong>Did we catch you at home? Thought so. Memorial Day Weekend, typically one of the busiest travel periods in the U.S., is almost unrecognizable this year. Highways are open, airports are mostly empty...even the line at Seacrets in Ocean City isn't looking too bad. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">None of this is surprising to travel execs, who say the pandemic is the worst crisis the sector has ever faced. In this week’s edition of the Brew’s New Normal series, we explore the world of pandemic-era travel. Tl;dr: It may involve a lot more bubbles.</p>
</td>
</tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LOCAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/shortterm-future-travel-regional?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When a State Park Is As Exciting As the Alps
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Lakeside chilling" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDQ1L2xha2VzaWRlX2NoaWxsaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Richard Bord/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the world of travel, the coronavirus pandemic has set us back 700 years. Leaving our little village now feels like seeing the world for the first time—WOW, did you know about that Walgreens on Route 9? Incredible! And what’s with these strange-looking people from the town over? They have short hair!</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As lockdowns ease, our radius of travel will widen, but it will remain much tighter than before. Here’s why <em>regional travel</em> will be popular in our “new normal.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Travelers may perceive it to be a safer alternative to long-distance travel.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s cheaper (U.S. unemployment sits at 14.7%).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Traveling internationally will be a logistical nightmare. Why go to Paris, France, when you’ve got Paris, TX? </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In fact, regional travel is already starting to pop up around the world in pockets known as “travel bubbles.” These bubbles form when adjacent countries call each other up, say “hey neighbor, looks like we’ve got this virus thing under control,” and open up borders to promote tourism and trade. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On May 15, Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania formed the first “</span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-52673373?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">travel bubble</a></span><span>” of the coronavirus era. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Australia and New Zealand have also floated the idea, but nothing has materialized yet.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Regional travel in the U.S.</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many analysts expect summer 2020 to herald the return of the Great American Road Trip, as travelers explore destinations closer to home in the comfort of their own cars. According to a <a href="https://www.gasbuddy.com/NewsRoom/PressRelease/909?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GasBuddy survey</a>…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>36% of respondents are canceling trips that require flying, and 24% plan to make shorter trips by distance. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>31% are planning to take a road trip (still down from 44% last year). </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Not to mention, gas prices around Memorial Day are the <a href="https://gasprices.aaa.com/motorists-to-see-cheapest-memorial-day-pump-prices-in-nearly-two-decades/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cheapest</a> they’ve been in almost 20 years, AAA says.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With your Machu Picchu trip replaced by Motel 6 hopping, all players in the travel industry—from airlines to hotels to booking sites and more—will need to adapt to the increasing popularity of more localized travel. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/international-air-travel-looks-whole-lot-different?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Meet International Businessman Alex Lébrewman
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Lego businessman" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=670 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l4q8hrNIxa0WHBw9a/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Lego businessman" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l4q8hrNIxa0WHBw9a/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy/Lego</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Morning Brew’s CEO has urgent newsletter business to attend to in Hong Kong and doesn't feel like taking a boat to get there. This is what Alex’s international travel experience might look like:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Booking the flight: </strong>A little more expensive than Alex would’ve hoped. Prices have made a <a href="https://bestlifeonline.com/flight-cost-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">steady recovery</a> since they hit rock bottom in March. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Arriving at the airport: </strong>Thermal cameras determine whether he has an <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/airline-travel-coronavirus-rules-11589823494?mod=hp_lead_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">elevated body temperature</a>. And there’s no wait at Starbucks? Huge.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Going through security: </strong>Airports are still struggling to find the balance between screening passengers more thoroughly but not creating huge lines. Alex steps up to a <a href="https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-health-screening-digital-id-48f5ee5b-05c4-4b5e-8fda-4d2f59b946b0.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CLEAR biometric scanner</a> to verify his digital ID and his health status. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">On the plane: </strong>Alex is instructed by the gate agent to <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/picture-gallery/travel/airline-news/2020/05/05/coronavirus-these-airlines-require-passengers-wear-face-masks/3085794001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don his mask</a>. His seat is in the back row, so he gets to board first. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Deplaning:</strong> Alex and the other passengers are instructed by flight attendants to deboard in small groups to maintain social distancing. Before clearing customs, Alex is required to download a <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/may/15/flying-long-haul-during-covid-19-air-travel-has-never-been-stranger?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">contact tracking app</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Clearing customs:</strong> Once he makes it through immigration, Alex is herded onto a bus and transported to a makeshift facility where he is given a testing kit to use on himself. After a 7-hour wait, he’s told he tested negative and is cleared to go about his important newsletter business.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOSPITALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/airbnb-vs-hotels-comes-top-era-covid19?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hotels or Home Rentals: Pick Your Poison
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the last decade, hoteliers have glared at Airbnb’s success like a dog leaving an unwelcome souvenir on their lawn. But COVID-19 <a href="https://skift.com/2020/05/05/airbnb-cuts-25-percent-of-workforce-and-downsizes-hotel-investments/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">doesn't care</a> whether you’re the disruptor or the disrupted.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Travel is resuming to a hospitality industry changed. </strong>Hotels are considering ending turndown service and ditching in-person check-in desks. Airbnb wants to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2020-04-22/airbnb-s-future-depends-on-a-post-pandemic-travel-boom?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">focus more on</a> part-time hosts and longer-term rentals for escaping city residents.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Who will <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/14/travel/hotels-versus-airbnb-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">win customers back</a> in this new normal? Let’s break it down, Rory Gilmore-style. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Hotels</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pros:</strong></span><span> More generous cancellation policies. </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/marriott-airbnb-hilton-redefine-hotel-cleanliness-standards-2020-4#hyatt-global-care-and-cleanliness-commitment-4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Professional cleaning services</a></span><span>. More consistency across locations. Marketing budgets.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Cons:</strong></span><span> Lobbies and elevators with more people bumping into each other. All of the fun perks (like bars, spas, pools) may be limited. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Rentals</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Pros: </strong></span><span>More units outside cities, which travelers may avoid. Fewer people sharing the building. Many offer self check-in. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Cons:</strong></span><span> Variability in cleaning. For rented rooms, less privacy and social distancing. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The new differentiator </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">“Cleanliness and hygiene will be the new five-star restaurant or 800-thread-count sheets,” industry analyst Henry Harteveldt told the NYT. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Airbnb has less hygiene standardization compared to a hotel chain with trained staff and industrial-grade cleaners. But it did <a href="https://skift.com/2020/05/13/airbnb-ceo-tells-hosts-success-against-hotel-competitors-hinges-on-adopting-cleaning-protocols/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">introduce</a> new cleaning protocols and will highlight hosts who comply. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>As was the case before the pandemic, there are tradeoffs to both hotels and short-term rentals. What may matter most is transparency around hygiene and flexibility in cancellations/refunds.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY MAGIC SPOON
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Halt Thou Scrolling for We Found the Magic Cereal
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://magicspoon.com/products/variety-pack-cereal-case/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsorship&utm_campaign=20200523" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Magic Spoon" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvNzY3LzE1OTAwMzY5MzEtbWFnaWMtc3Bvb24tYm93bC1hbmQtc3Bvb24tdmFyaWV0eS1wYWNrLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After many days and many nights—having traversed the land of couches, forded the river of phone chargers, and climbed the mountain of ramen noodles—we came upon <a href="https://magicspoon.com/products/variety-pack-cereal-case/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsorship&utm_campaign=20200523" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the magic cereal</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When word reached us that there is <a href="https://magicspoon.com/products/variety-pack-cereal-case/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsorship&utm_campaign=20200523" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a cereal</a> that <strong style="color:#000">recreates our favorite childhood breakfasts with more protein, less carbs, and zero sugar</strong>, we believed it to be a fantasy. And then, found it:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://magicspoon.com/products/variety-pack-cereal-case/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsorship&utm_campaign=20200523" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Magic Spoon</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This healthy cereal is the ideal thing to have in your pantry right now. Somehow—we’re thinking sorcery—it packs all the things you love about classic cereal into a <strong style="color:#000">gluten, grain, soy, and junk-free</strong> package. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From fruity and cinnamon to cocoa and frosted, their flavors are <strong style="color:#000">truly tasty</strong>. And TIME Magazine named Magic Spoon a <strong style="color:#000">Top 100 Invention of 2019</strong>. For cereal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://magicspoon.com/products/variety-pack-cereal-case/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsorship&utm_campaign=20200523" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Join us in the fantasy that is Magic Spoon’s magical cereal today</a>. Don’t forget the code “BREW” at checkout for free shipping.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BUSINESS TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/business-travel-downbut-not?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Will Delta Sky Club Lounges Ever Fill Up Again?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sperrys have become an endangered species at Scottsdale’s finest Hiltons. 92% of corporate travel managers say their employers have <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/20/business/business-travel-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceled or suspended</a> all or most domestic travel, while sales for business travel booking service AmEx Global Business Travel <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/carlyle-gic-back-away-from-amex-global-business-travel-deal-11589031717?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly fell</a> 70% year-over-year in March. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Most Fortune 500 CEOs said they </span><span><a href="https://fortune.com/2020/05/14/fortune-500-ceo-survey-coronavirus-pandemic-predictions/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">don’t expect</a></span><span> business travel to </span><span><em>ever</em></span><span> return to pre-pandemic levels.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And according to </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/sanofi-ceo-the-one-meeting-trip-will-disappear-11585918803?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sanofi's CEO</a></span><span>, "the one-meeting trip will disappear forever." (It may never have been necessary in the first place.)</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then there's the growing WFH movement. Large tech companies including Facebook, Twitter, Spotify, and others have all signaled they'll allow a large chunk of their workforce to work from home...permanently. If these companies don't think it's worth it for employees to commute 30 min. to the office, why would they pay to fly in consultants from other cities?  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, not <em>all </em>business travel will disappear, especially at the highest rungs of the corporate ladder. You need to look someone in the eye when you propose a $100 billion takeover—you just might not shake their hand when you seal the deal.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Former Spirit Airlines CEO Ben Baldanza <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/danielreed/2020/04/15/covid-19-wont-kill-leisure-or-business-travel-but-it-will-change-it-significantly-perhaps-forever/#2e2b532650b4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimates</a> business travel will permanently fall 5%–10% as a result of the coronavirus. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

</a><span>  </span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VIRTUAL REALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/will-next-vacation-virtual-reality?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Virtual Travel: Can’t Lose Your Bags If You Don’t Leave Home
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So the pandemic has knocked out traditional travel. But it’s 2020—why <em>actually</em> go somewhere when you could metaverse-go somewhere?  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>You probably remember getting emails from every publication you’ve ever glanced at hawking virtual tours of </span><span><a href="https://naturalhistory2.si.edu/vt3/NMNH/z_tour-022.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Smithsonian</a></span><span> to </span><span><a href="https://www.travelandleisure.com/attractions/landmarks-monuments/virtual-hike-great-wall-of-china?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the Great Wall of China</a></span><span> the moment lockdowns began. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The value prop: </strong>Virtual reality (VR) travel advocates <a href="https://www.nationalgeographic.com/travel/2020/04/can-virtual-reality-replace-real-tourism-during-pandemic-and-beyond/#close?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were touting</a> its environmental benefits even before the pandemic. And now we’ve all seen those photos of Venice’s crystal-clear canals.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Some VR travel firms like Ascape are fielding growing interest in their products; Ascape's app downloads were up 60% over December, per NatGeo. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But virtual reality can’t (yet) capture the real joys of travel</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">...like the taste of tiramisu, the smell of crisp Andean air, or the sensation of 32 strangers’ bodies huddled next to you on the Paris Métro. But VR can support the travel biz in other ways, like <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/02/coronavirus-could-be-catalyst-to-reinvigorate-virtual-reality-headsets.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">marketing and planning</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Most of the fun of a trip is preparing the itinerary, anyway. And with a VR headset and software, you can better scope out where you’d be going.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>VR hasn’t yet lived up to Oculus founder Palmer Luckey’s prediction that it will “change the world.” However, while the pandemic won't lead to all of us taking vacations in headsets, virtual experiences could eventually become a useful tool for travel companies.</p>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nLOCAL\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhen a State Park Is As Exciting As the Alps\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Lakeside chilling\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMDQ1L2xha2VzaWRlX2NoaWxsaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eRichard Bord/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the world of travel, the coronavirus pandemic has set us back 700 years. Leaving our little village now feels like seeing the world for the first time—WOW, did you know about that Walgreens on Route 9? Incredible! And what’s with these strange-looking people from the town over? They have short hair!\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs lockdowns ease, our radius of travel will widen, but it will remain much tighter than before. Here’s why \u003cem\u003eregional travel\u003c/em\u003e will be popular in our “new normal.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTravelers may perceive it to be a safer alternative to long-distance travel.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s cheaper (U.S. unemployment sits at 14.7%).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTraveling internationally will be a logistical nightmare. Why go to Paris, France, when you’ve got Paris, TX? \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn fact, regional travel is already starting to pop up around the world in pockets known as “travel bubbles.” These bubbles form when adjacent countries call each other up, say “hey neighbor, looks like we’ve got this virus thing under control,” and open up borders to promote tourism and trade. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOn May 15, Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania formed the first “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-52673373?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etravel bubble\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e” of the coronavirus era. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAustralia and New Zealand have also floated the idea, but nothing has materialized yet.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRegional travel in the U.S.\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany analysts expect summer 2020 to herald the return of the Great American Road Trip, as travelers explore destinations closer to home in the comfort of their own cars. According to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.gasbuddy.com/NewsRoom/PressRelease/909?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eGasBuddy survey\u003c/a\u003e…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e36% of respondents are canceling trips that require flying, and 24% plan to make shorter trips by distance. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e31% are planning to take a road trip (still down from 44% last year). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNot to mention, gas prices around Memorial Day are the \u003ca href=\"https://gasprices.aaa.com/motorists-to-see-cheapest-memorial-day-pump-prices-in-nearly-two-decades/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echeapest\u003c/a\u003e they’ve been in almost 20 years, AAA says.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith your Machu Picchu trip replaced by Motel 6 hopping, all players in the travel industry—from airlines to hotels to booking sites and more—will need to adapt to the increasing popularity of more localized travel. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nMeet International Businessman Alex Lébrewman\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Lego businessman\" style=\"display: block; style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy/Lego\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMorning Brew’s CEO has urgent newsletter business to attend to in Hong Kong and doesn't feel like taking a boat to get there. This is what Alex’s international travel experience might look like:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBooking the flight: \u003c/strong\u003eA little more expensive than Alex would’ve hoped. Prices have made a \u003ca href=\"https://bestlifeonline.com/flight-cost-coronavirus/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esteady recovery\u003c/a\u003e since they hit rock bottom in March. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eArriving at the airport: \u003c/strong\u003eThermal cameras determine whether he has an \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/airline-travel-coronavirus-rules-11589823494?mod=hp_lead_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eelevated body temperature\u003c/a\u003e. And there’s no wait at Starbucks? Huge.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGoing through security: \u003c/strong\u003eAirports are still struggling to find the balance between screening passengers more thoroughly but not creating huge lines. Alex steps up to a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-health-screening-digital-id-48f5ee5b-05c4-4b5e-8fda-4d2f59b946b0.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCLEAR biometric scanner\u003c/a\u003e to verify his digital ID and his health status. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOn the plane: \u003c/strong\u003eAlex is instructed by the gate agent to \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/picture-gallery/travel/airline-news/2020/05/05/coronavirus-these-airlines-require-passengers-wear-face-masks/3085794001/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edon his mask\u003c/a\u003e. His seat is in the back row, so he gets to board first. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDeplaning:\u003c/strong\u003e Alex and the other passengers are instructed by flight attendants to deboard in small groups to maintain social distancing. Before clearing customs, Alex is required to download a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/may/15/flying-long-haul-during-covid-19-air-travel-has-never-been-stranger?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtact tracking app\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eClearing customs:\u003c/strong\u003e Once he makes it through immigration, Alex is herded onto a bus and transported to a makeshift facility where he is given a testing kit to use on himself. After a 7-hour wait, he’s told he tested negative and is cleared to go about his important newsletter business.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nHOSPITALITY \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/airbnb-vs-hotels-comes-top-era-covid19?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nHotels or Home Rentals: Pick Your Poison\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor the last decade, hoteliers have glared at Airbnb’s success like a dog leaving an unwelcome souvenir on their lawn. But COVID-19 \u003ca href=\"https://skift.com/2020/05/05/airbnb-cuts-25-percent-of-workforce-and-downsizes-hotel-investments/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edoesn't care\u003c/a\u003e whether you’re the disruptor or the disrupted.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTravel is resuming to a hospitality industry changed. \u003c/strong\u003eHotels are considering ending turndown service and ditching in-person check-in desks. Airbnb wants to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/features/2020-04-22/airbnb-s-future-depends-on-a-post-pandemic-travel-boom?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efocus more on\u003c/a\u003e part-time hosts and longer-term rentals for escaping city residents.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWho will \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/05/14/travel/hotels-versus-airbnb-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewin customers back\u003c/a\u003e in this new normal? Let’s break it down, Rory Gilmore-style. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHotels\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePros:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e More generous cancellation policies. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/marriott-airbnb-hilton-redefine-hotel-cleanliness-standards-2020-4#hyatt-global-care-and-cleanliness-commitment-4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eProfessional cleaning services\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. More consistency across locations. Marketing budgets.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCons:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Lobbies and elevators with more people bumping into each other. All of the fun perks (like bars, spas, pools) may be limited. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRentals\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePros: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore units outside cities, which travelers may avoid. Fewer people sharing the building. Many offer self check-in. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCons:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Variability in cleaning. For rented rooms, less privacy and social distancing. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe new differentiator \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e“Cleanliness and hygiene will be the new five-star restaurant or 800-thread-count sheets,” industry analyst Henry Harteveldt told the NYT. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAirbnb has less hygiene standardization compared to a hotel chain with trained staff and industrial-grade cleaners. But it did \u003ca href=\"https://skift.com/2020/05/13/airbnb-ceo-tells-hosts-success-against-hotel-competitors-hinges-on-adopting-cleaning-protocols/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eintroduce\u003c/a\u003e new cleaning protocols and will highlight hosts who comply. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAs was the case before the pandemic, there are tradeoffs to both hotels and short-term rentals. What may matter most is transparency around hygiene and flexibility in cancellations/refunds.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eMost Fortune 500 CEOs said they \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eever\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e return to pre-pandemic levels.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd according to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/sanofi-ceo-the-one-meeting-trip-will-disappear-11585918803?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSanofi's CEO\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \"the one-meeting trip will disappear forever.\" (It may never have been necessary in the first place.)\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen there's the growing WFH movement. Large tech companies including Facebook, Twitter, Spotify, and others have all signaled they'll allow a large chunk of their workforce to work from home...permanently. If these companies don't think it's worth it for employees to commute 30 min. to the office, why would they pay to fly in consultants from other cities?  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, not \u003cem\u003eall \u003c/em\u003ebusiness travel will disappear, especially at the highest rungs of the corporate ladder. You need to look someone in the eye when you propose a $100 billion takeover—you just might not shake their hand when you seal the deal.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nVirtual Travel: Can’t Lose Your Bags If You Don’t Leave Home\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo the pandemic has knocked out traditional travel. But it’s 2020—why \u003cem\u003eactually\u003c/em\u003e go somewhere when you could metaverse-go somewhere?  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYou probably remember getting emails from every publication you’ve ever glanced at hawking virtual tours of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://naturalhistory2.si.edu/vt3/NMNH/z_tour-022.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThe Smithsonian\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.travelandleisure.com/attractions/landmarks-monuments/virtual-hike-great-wall-of-china?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe Great Wall of China\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the moment lockdowns began. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe value prop: \u003c/strong\u003eVirtual reality (VR) travel advocates \u003ca href=\"https://www.nationalgeographic.com/travel/2020/04/can-virtual-reality-replace-real-tourism-during-pandemic-and-beyond/#close?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere touting\u003c/a\u003e its environmental benefits even before the pandemic. And now we’ve all seen those photos of Venice’s crystal-clear canals.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSome VR travel firms like Ascape are fielding growing interest in their products; Ascape's app downloads were up 60% over December, per NatGeo. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut virtual reality can’t (yet) capture the real joys of travel\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e...like the taste of tiramisu, the smell of crisp Andean air, or the sensation of 32 strangers’ bodies huddled next to you on the Paris Métro. But VR can support the travel biz in other ways, like \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/05/02/coronavirus-could-be-catalyst-to-reinvigorate-virtual-reality-headsets.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emarketing and planning\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMost of the fun of a trip is preparing the itinerary, anyway. And with a VR headset and software, you can better scope out where you’d be going.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eVR hasn’t yet lived up to Oculus founder Palmer Luckey’s prediction that it will “change the world.” However, while the pandemic won't lead to all of us taking vacations in headsets, virtual experiences could eventually become a useful tool for travel companies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
